intro: Melothria leucocarpa var. triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed sour sop, is a tropical vine native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are typically three-lobed and have a glossy, dark green appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into the distinctive, spiky, green fruit. The fruit is known for its acidic, tangy flavor and is often used in culinary and medicinal applications. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
